issue.title: Cannot pip install tsai

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

repository.name: tsai
repository.description: Time series Timeseries Deep Learning Machine Learning Pytorch  fastai | State-of-the-art Deep Learning library  for Time Series and Sequences in Pytorch / fastai

issue.body:
I've noticed there's a problem when trying to install tsai. 
The issue is related to one of its dependencies: sktime. 
I've just opened an issue with them (https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2033). We'll hopefully get a fix soon. 
In the meantime you can install tsai using the following code: 

```bash
pip install statsmodels==0.12.1
pip install "sktime>=0.9.0,<0.10.0"
pip install tsai
```
Apologies for the inconvenience.

body:
Thanks for reporting this, @oguiza!

Can you kindly let us know what exactly happens in colab?
I just started it, and for me it seems to hang after `statsmodels`.
`pip install sktime -v` should help diagnose it, but thereÂ´s a lot of output to go through...

> Thanks for reporting this, @oguiza!
> 
> Can you kindly let us know what exactly happens in colab? I just started it, and for me it seems to hang after `statsmodels`.

Same thing for me. 
I reported it in the details section of the bug description.

rename.to: [BUG] in colab, pip install sktime hangs after statsmodels download

body:
@oguiza, `sktime` should run again in colab in v0.10.1.
We haven't tracked down the root cause or its location, but the upper bound on `statsmodels` seems to have done the trick.
Thanks for the info @fkiraly. I've tested it too and it's resolved.

welllllll - not entirely resolved. The problem is probably still there if you remove the `scipy<1.8.0` bound, and the reason for that is not entirely inderstood. I'll re-open this issue since we need to ensure that we don't have the problem with `scipy 1.8.0` and higher.

rename.from: [BUG] in colab, pip install sktime hangs after statsmodels download
rename.to: [BUG] in colab, pip install sktime hangs after statsmodels download for `scipy=1.8.0`

body:
I understand. 
I just closed it as the issue as originally described no longer occurs. You can now pip install sktime in Colab.
